attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We Demand the government to recognize the "Turkish Cypriot Genocide" perpetrated by the Greek Cypriots in 1964, 1967 and 1974.

Info:
Northern Ireland Union Party Strangford Deputy John Taylor called on the British government to recognize the Turkish-Cypriot Genocide. Taylor said details of the genocide could be found in Harry-Scott-Gibbons' book entitled "Genocide File". Stating the English archives also proved the genocide, Taylor said British newspapers of that period gave wide coverage to the Greek-Cypriot cruelties with photographs. Taylor demanded those responsibles for this savagery who are still living on the island, be brought before the law.

We now petition the same thing, we want Action to be taken to recognize the Genocide and all responsible peoples be bought to justice at once.

rejection.details: The British Government believes that the intercommunal violence in Cyprus during the 1960s and 1970s should not be categorised as genocide as defined by the 1948 UN Convention on Genocide.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
